title: Convention delegates have higher education levels

content.prompt: Which of the following best explains why delegates to both the Republican and Democratic Conventions in 1996 were much more likely to have college and postgraduate degrees than was the rest of the voting population?

choices.label: College education increases the likelihood of holding liberal political positions.
College education increases the likelihood of holding conservative political positions.
Education allows people to have more time to attend conventions.
Some states required delegates to hold college degrees.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
